required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LUT014 for the Treatment of Radiation Induced Dermatitis in Breast Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Part (Open-Label Followed by Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled) Phase 1/2 Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Topically Administered LUT014 for the Treatment of Radiation-Induced Dermatitis in Breast Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of LUT014 gel topically administered in breast cancer patients who developed radiation dermatitis. Subjects enrolled to part 1 will be enrolled to receive the study treatment (open label treatment) for 28 days and will be followed up for 2 months after the completion of study treatment. Subject in Part 2 will be randomized in 1:1 ratio to receive either the study drug or placebo (double-blind treatment) for qd topical application for 28 days and will be followed up for 2 months after the completion of study treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events as assessed by CTCAE (Part 1 subjects)
primary_outcome.description: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Version 5.0

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the severity of radiation dermatitis based on self reporting Dermatology QoL questionnaire (Part 2 subjects)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the severity of radiation dermatitis assessed by CTCAE (Part 1 subjects)
secondary_outcome.description: CTCAE grading scale for dermatitis radiation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the severity of radiation dermatitis assessed by RTOG/EORTC (part 1 subjects)
secondary_outcome.description: Toxicity criteria of the Radiation Therapy Oncology Group (RTOG) and the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the severity of radiation dermatitis based on self reporting Dermatology QoL questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Dermatology Life Quality Index questionnaire (part 1 subjects)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events as assessed by CTCAE (Part 2 subjects)
secondary_outcome.description: CTCAE grading scale for dermatitis radiation

arm_group.description: LUT014 Gel topical application to the dermatitis area qd for 28 days

intervention.description: Matching placebo for qd topical application for 28 days
